activities.loc: Richland County Courtroom, Floor C, Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon R. Bird-Duell

records.addlTxt:
2:41 PM 21CF150, 21CF151, 21CF153, 22CF109, Unfiled case - Defendant Brandon R. Bird-Duell in court.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. 

State ask that the initial be adjourn in the unfiled case and speaks about the no contact staying in place. 

Court speaks about representation again with BB. BB has contacted multiple attorney's and is waiting on a call back. BB asks for three weeks. 

Court resets to allow BB time to get an attorney.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:08 PM  21CF150, 21CF151, 21CF153 - Defendant Brandon Bird-Duell in court, in custody. Attorney Harper appears in person. Attorney Dadoun appears. Court will sign the order to withdraw as BD attorney. BB has spoken to Attorney Bartelt and is working on hiring him.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

3:21 PM Two unfiled cases, 21CF150, 21CF151, 21CF153 and 22CF109 - Defendant Brandon R. Bird-Duell in court.  Attorney Julie A Dadoun in court for Brandon R. Bird-Duell.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Dadoun states that a conflict has appeared. Court speaks about counsel and indicates that he doesn't qualify for the public defender or dean appointment. Court states that BB needs to hire an attorney on his own. Court reviews the petition for counsel that was filed in 22CF109.

Court will allow Attorney Dadoun to withdraw. 

Court speaks about the unfiled cases. Attorney Harper asks that the defendant be released from bond on the two case. (42 and 43) 

Court resets for 10/13/22 at 1 PM.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of indigency

1:25 PM Defendant Brandon R. Bird-Duell in court.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. BB doesn't have an attorney and asks for Attorney Dadoun for counsel. Max penalties stated. Court advised BB to fill out the petition for counsel and must bring back the paperwork at the next hearing.

Attorney Harper states that the victim would like to have this case dropped. Victim heard.

Victim ask that the no contact be removed. Court will remove the no contact.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

1:03 PM Defendant Brandon Bird-Duell appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Harper appears in person. 

State asks for a $5,000 cash 
No contact with Valarie P.

BD isn't able to post any money.
29011 East Richard Street, Lone Rock was given by the defendant as his address.

Court orders $1,000 Cash bond.
No contact with Valarie P.

Initial set for 08/12/22 at 1 PM
Hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
